5223.verse: أَسْكِنُوهُنَّ|Lodge them|110|125|17011$مِنْ حَيْثُ|[from] where|107|137|17012$سَكَنتُم|you dwell,|87|117|17013$مِّن|(out) of|72|102|53$وُجْدِكُمْ|your means|96|126|17014$وَلَا|and (do) not|104|119|25$تُضَآرُّوهُنَّ|harm them|123|138|17015$لِتُضَيِّقُواْ|to distress|99|128|17016$عَلَيْهِنَّ‌ۚ|[on] them.|91|120|2000$وَإِن|And if|58|87|213$كُنَّ|they are|76|105|1992$أُوْلَـٰتِ حَمْلٍ|pregnant,|133|148|17017$فَأَنفِقُواْ|then spend|94|104|17018$عَلَيْهِنَّ|on them|79|99|2000$حَتَّىٰ|until|64|84|526$يَضَعْنَ|they deliver|98|118|12659$حَمْلَهُنَّ‌ۚ|their burden.|105|125|17009$فَإِنْ|Then if|66|86|227$أَرْضَعْنَ|they suckle|100|110|17019$لَكُمْ|for you,|72|78|207$فَـَٔـاتُوهُنَّ|then give them|120|133|3892$أُجُورَهُنَّ‌ۖ|their payment,|117|130|3893$وَأْتَمِرُواْ|and consult|99|112|17020$بَيْنَكُم|among yourselves|138|151|1657$بِمَعْرُوفٍ‌ۖ|with kindness,|114|120|2006$وَإِن|but if|58|81|213$تَعَاسَرْتُمْ|you disagree,|109|156|17021$فَسَتُرْضِعُ|then may suckle|128|174|17022$لَهُۥٓ|for him|65|112|977$أُخْرَىٰ|another (women).|139|162|4392$

5223.verse: Lodge them [in a section] of where you dwell out of your means and do not harm them in order to oppress them. And if they should be pregnant, then spend on them until they give birth. And if they breastfeed for you, then give them their payment and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way; but if you are in discord, then there may breastfeed for the father another woman.

5224.verse: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what Allah has given him. Allah does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. Allah will bring about, after hardship, ease.

5225.verse: And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.

5226.verse: And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair, and the outcome of its affair was loss.

5227.verse: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear Allah, O you of understanding who have believed. Allah has sent down to you the Qur'an.

5228.verse: [He sent] a Messenger [Muhammad] reciting to you the distinct verses of Allah that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds from darknesses into the light. And whoever believes in Allah and does righteousness - He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein forever. Allah will have perfected for him a provision.

5229.verse: It is Allah who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. [His] command descends among them so you may know that Allah is over all things competent and that Allah has encompassed all things in knowledge.
